data.title: SVP, Sales and Operations - Niantic, Inc.
data.meta_description: Find articles by Erin Schaefer, SVP, Sales and Operations of Niantic, Inc. in the Computer Software industry and member of the Forbes Business Development Council
data.text:
Proven media and technology business leader with deep expertise in enabling growth across Operations, Partnerships, Sales and Finance via scaling teams, strategy, and processes. With a strong reputation as a collaborative leader who inspires followership, able to attract and retain the best talent, ensure they execute effectively and beyond their own expectations, and build deep and productive cross-functional relationships. Key Competencies: - DELIVERS - Consistent track record of over-delivering results including: growing businesses from $0 in revenue to $100M, $100M to $1B and $1B to $xB, exceeding partner and user satisfaction goals, and building and executing an operation to effectively remove terrorist content from YouTube - THRIVES IN AMBIGUITY - Leads successful turnarounds and effectively builds new teams in the face of uncertainty as evidenced by notable pivot of YouTube Trust & Safety from a reactive to proactive organization and the development of the go-to-market function, first piloted in YouTube and then expanded to all Ads businesses and Product Areas - CHALLENGES THE STATUS QUO - Delivers creative solutions to dramatically change the business trajectory or operations, including conception, development and execution of Google Preferred, YouTube’s true TV alternative advertising package as well as initiating and then landing a holistic change to YouTube’s partner service model to drive increased consistency and impact - INSPIRES - Incites followership and molds high performing teams by setting a clear vision and accompanying strategy as well as by continually demonstrating understanding of each role and value of each employee. Winner of Great Manager Award (given to less than 1% of leaders, nominated by direct team). Consistently receive highest employee satisfaction scores (93% favorable) among peers.

Niantic is the world’s leading AR technology company, sparking creative and engaging journeys in the real world. Our products inspire outdoor exploration, exercise, and meaningful social interaction. Originally formed at Google in 2011, we became an independent company in 2015 with a strong group of investors including Nintendo, The Pokémon Company, and Alsop Louie Partners. Our current titles include pioneering global-control game Ingress, record-breaking AR game Pokémon GO, Pikmin Bloom, and coming soon: NBA All-World, Marvel World of Heroes, and Peridot. Niantic is an Equal Opportunity employer. We believe that cultivating a workplace where our people are supported and included is essential to creating great products our community will love. Our mission emphasizes seeking and hiring diverse voices, including those who are traditionally underrepresented in the technology industry, and we consider this to be one of the most important values we hold close. We're a hard-working, fun, and exciting group who values intellectual curiosity and a passion for problem-solving! We have growing offices located in San Francisco, Sunnyvale, Bellevue, Los Angeles, London, Tokyo, Hamburg, and Zurich.
